meanings.definition: A small group of people working together as a unit.
meanings.sent1: Our squad played soccer together every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The squad of friends went on a hike in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The squad decided to have a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: The squad of birds flew in perfect formation across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The squad of ants worked tirelessly to build their nest.

meanings.definition: A unit of police officers or soldiers.
meanings.sent1: The police squad patrolled the neighborhood at night.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's squad trained hard for the upcoming mission.
meanings.sent3: The squad of officers stopped for donuts on their break.
meanings.sent4: The squad of soldiers marched in perfect sync during the parade.
meanings.sent5: The SWAT squad was called in for a high-risk operation.
